Name: King Hùng Era
Description:
This game can be played by 2-4 players.  Each player will have 8 units.  The units can be played as single, a pair, set of 3, set of 4.  Set of 5 will win the game instantly.  Winning set will stay face up while others will be deposited into the bucket.

The objective of the game is to have as many units faced up at the end as possible, with being subject to last unit scoring rule.

---

Components of the game:
32 tiles
 • 16 Red Kingdom Units
 • 16 Blue Kingdom Units
1 bucket or the game box
40 gold coins: 10 x value 3, 30 x value 1
4 tile holders
1 rule book

---

The game includes 32 tiles, of which 16 are Red Kingdom units and 16 are Blue Kingdom units.  Red has higher power ranking than Blue of the same unit.
•    1 Red King and 1 Blue King
•    1 Red Queen and 1 Blue Queen
•    1 Red Princess and 1 Blue Princess
•    2 Red Chancellor and 2 Blue Chancellor
•    2 Red Rook and 2 Blue Rook
•    2 Red Bishop and 2 Blue Bishop
•    2 Red Knight and 2 Blue Knight
•    5 Red Pawn and 5 Blue Pawn

Winning units must be played in qualified set of 1, 2, 3, 4. Set of 5 will win the game instantly.

---

Last Unit Rule:

If a lone King (Blue or Red) end the game, it earns 2 coins while units other than King - for example, lone Rook (5), pair of Pawns (1+5), set of King-Queen-Chancellor (1+1+5) - all will earn 5 coins for the last unit.

—description from the publisher

Name: Zombies!!!: Vegas
Description:
(From the Kickstarter campaign page):

Twilight Creations has always put fans first in everything we do, and this time we’re letting you design all aspects of this game! Welcome to Zombies!!!: Sin City [The title was later changed for Zombies!!!: Vegas]. What happens here stays here!!!

This next installment of Zombies!!! is a bit different than anything we've done before. The game requires players to complete mini games in order to be able to leave Vegas and win the game. The mini games will be created by YOU! We are very excited about this project and we hope you are too!

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Hope Stealer
Description:
Promo gear card that were included with the Halloween's Pinup Devil Satan, which is not part of the game.

Satan dressed up as... the Devil! The Devil Satan kit comes with 2 miniatures. A 54mm scale model perfect for painters and a 35mm scale model for gamers looking for a fun survivor stand-in for their Halloween gaming session.It also includes the Hope Stealer, a gear card that modifies a specific Hunt Event!

Name: Tropicano
Description:
Far out in the ocean is a small, mysterious island where people say a treasure is hidden. However, the young pirates can’t approach the island directly by boat, because the surrounding sea is too rough and dangerous – and they would all get seasick! Then they have the idea of building a bridge. This will help them reach their goal in safety, even though the big waves make building difficult. Keep a cool head and use your building skills, and your pirate may be the first to make a stable bridge which he can cross to reach the island and find the treasure.

The players take turns to throw the symbol dice and gradually construct a bridge with the pieces thrown. The first player to finish building a complete bridge to the small island is allowed to cross it straight away and dig up the treasure.

The parent/teacher takes a “treasure” (e.g. a couple jelly bears, or a little treasure chest) and hides it under the palm tree.

Name: Waddingtons Pony Express
Description:
The wild west mail delivering strategy game by Waddingtons.

"...when the mail's just gotta get through..."
—description from the game box

"Object:
The object of the game is to be the first person to deliver all his mail and return safely to his home town.

Equipment:
The equipment consists of a playing board, four dispatch boards, four player pieces, three playing dice and one Indian die, forty-two mail cards, twenty-seven Desparado (red) cards and twenty-seven Bonanza (blue} cards"

—description from the instructions

Name: Taco Perfecto
Description:
Make the perfect taco! Add yummy toppings, dodge the ingredients you don't like, and spice your taco just right.

Players are dealt three "gusto" cards. Choose two of them. These are your favorite ingredients, kept secret from the other players.

Each player also gets a hand of three "ingredient" cards, and three "spice" cards. Players take turns playing cards into piles that represent different tacos, drawing from one of two decks to replace the type of card they just played.

Ingredients are played face up, covering previously played ingredients, and spice cards are played face down, but in a column so you can see how many (but not the value of) cards have been played. There are also cards like "Picky Eater" and "Mystery Pepper" that have special effects on your taco's taste.

When you think a taco has the right ingredients and spices, instead of playing a card on your turn, claim one of the tacos, removing it from play. Once all players have claimed a taco, the player with the tastiest taco (most points) wins!


    +5 if your spice sore is between 15 and 20
    +3 for each topping that matches your gusto cards
    +2 for each Sour Cream card
    +1 for each Lime Juice
    -1 for each non-matching topping


—description from the publisher

Name: Beat Auction
Description:
Each player offers music such as drum and bass, hip hop, trance, techno, and house. You'll bid for these in an auction and hold a Club Event.
Behind the scenes you can earn money or use the money to hold an Event. Success or failure depends on how well you read the music trend. The player who wins the game is the one who wins the most money and brings the greatest impact to the music scene.

—user summary

Name: Maguro Zukushi
Description:
This is a sushi-themed mahjong-like card game for two.

At the start of the game each player is dealt eleven cards. Five of these are put face down as your "prep", and then you each take turns discarding cards. To win you have to make a hand of either two sets of three-of-a-kind or three pairs by combining your prep and your opponent's discard. There's a catch, though - like in mahjong, you can't win with a discard that you've already discarded yourself. The points for winning hands also depend on what sushi you use in the sets, so will you try for big points or go for a lower-scoring hand your opponent is more likely to discard?

—user summary

Name: Lost Tales of Cthulhu: Dunwich
Description:
This is a Cthulhu version of Lost Legacy; while the game designer is different they officially licensed the Lost Legacy Rules.

A simple game where you play one card each turn, you'll try to save the world from destruction by ancient horrors in just ten minutes.

The setting is based on HP Lovecraft's the Dunwich Horror, set after the events of the story.

—user summary

Name: Lost Tales of Cthulhu: Dunwich of the Dead
Description:
This standalone expansion to Lost Tales of Cthulhu: Dunwich changes the horror from traditional Cthulhu horrors to Zombies. Can you save the world in a town overrun by the undead?

—user summary

Name: Fuji Koro: Deluxe
Description:
Japan HÅsei 4 (1707).

Mount Fuji is on the verge of erupting. Red hot lava will soon consume the three secret Seien-ji (è–ç…™å¯º), sacred temples hidden deep in the bowels of the volcano. The ShÅgun is determined to preserve the precious heritage and sends his most noble and gifted samurai warriors on a quest inside the volcano to retrieve the valuable goods.

After a grueling climb through snowstorms and treacherous rocky terrain the samurai find the entrance that leads down into the cavern.

The volcano rumbles and the walls start shaking! The floor underneath their feet crumbles and our brave samurai fall into the huge cavern that contains the three temples, which are slowly sinking into the smoldering lava.

It is now up to our heroes to explore the cavern and find as many of the relics, sacred scrolls, and monks as possible, to bring back safely to the Shogun before the volcano erupts and all is lost forever.

Fuji Koro can be played in a competitive mode with 2 to 6 players or a cooperative mode with 1 to 6 players.

Players will try and gather sacred scrolls and blueprints for magical weapons, gather resources, craft the best possible gear, and try to get out of the volcano before it fully erupts. To make matter worse, players will encounter fantastical dragons on their journey throughout the volcano, that they will have to try and defeat by themselves or with the help of other players.

The game continues until the end phase of the game, which is triggered by one player reaching 30 victory points. Once that happens, players will have 8 final turns to escape the volcano.

To win the game, a player will have to score the most victory points by defeating dragons, exploring the cave, crafting the right weapons and bringing magical gear, dragon teeth and monks to the ShÅgun during the end phase of the game.

Extra's from KS campaign:

     Extra large double-sided game board
     Extra solid cardboard box
     6 Highly detailed Samurai miniatures
     13 Highly detailed Dragon miniatures
     Premium sleeves and tuckbox
     Wooden pieces replacing cardboard pieces: monks, sacred scrolls, magical blueprints,etc. ...with heat transfer print
     KS exclusive Ninja character

Name: Guildraft
Description:
This game was included with the IoGioco magazine (issue number 10).

Hire the best characters to find the best treasures and make your guild rich.
The player who earns the best total value of treasures at the end of the game is the winner.

The game has two phases: the character selection phase and the treasure conquest phase. 
In the first phase every player is dealt an equal amount of cards; then each player will draft his own characters by choosing one from his hand and passing the rest, going on until cards are finished. This will form his hand in the second phase
In the second phase treasure cards are revealed and every player  chooses simultaneously a card from his hand. The highest character card chooses the treasure first, after character effects are applied.

At the end the value of each treasure is summed up and trophies are awarded based on number of treasures of a certain kind; highest value wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle – Promo Pack 1
Description:
This set is a fixed assortment of 56 crypt cards, intended as promotional material for retailers and event organizer

Contents are detailed below. The number before each card is the  number of copies of that card in the bundle.

10 Lord Tremere
10 Mithras
10 Montano
10 The Capuchin
10 The Dracon
1 Helena Advanced
1 Karsh Advanced 
1 Menele Advanced
1 Nergal
1 Nergal Advanced 
1 Yazid Tamari Advanced
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – Pit of Snakes
Description:
Beware the treacheries of the church and the court in Pit of Snakes, the third Chapter Pack in the King's Landing cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game!

In the sixth cycle of A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, you are free to explore the streets and alleys of the capital of the Seven Kingdoms without being bound to a linear set of events as played out in A Song of Ice and Fire.

Pit of Snakes takes you to the heart of King's Landing, where wise Maesters, noble Lords, and cunning Ladies spin their intrigues in pursuit of power with the continued exploration of the shadow keyword, first introduced in the Dance of Shadows cycle. Featuring new versions of key characters and a variety of cards to help you build a deck around The Seven trait, this Chapter Pack provides you with the tools you need to take your battles in Westeros to the next level. But be wary—the more power you gain, the greater target you become!

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: UNO: High School Musical 3
Description:
Celebrate senior year with the students of East High in this special edition of UNO.



     Make the underclassmen jealous with the special Graduation card and rule!



     And get ready to toss your cap in the air and yell "UNO!" when you are about to make the grade!


—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Bonds of Blood
Description:
Step into the world of Rokugan with Bonds of Blood, the second Dynasty Pack in the Inheritance cycle for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game!

The Inheritance cycle sees Rokugan splinter like never before and places on emphasis on Bushi and Courtiers, as well as introducing the Disguised mechanism, allowing iconic samurai to remain in the shadows until the perfect moment. Bonds of Blood includes a prolific Phoenix Shugenja, new provinces for the Lion and Unicorn, a deadly new Poison card for the Scorpion, and more!
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Rebel Veterans Unit Expansion
Description:
With instincts honed in the trenches, Rebel veterans are often assigned the hardest and most vital jobs in the war against the Empire. Through the countless hopeless battles on desolate worlds that they have seen, Rebel veterans can always be relied upon to get the job done, to hold the line, or to  fight to the bitter end.

With the Rebel Veterans Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion, you can add seven unique unpainted Rebel veteran miniatures to your collection, including a Mark II Medium Blaster Trooper miniature that can be deployed as a detachment, offering valuable fire support to all of your units. Accompanying these miniatures are two unit cards, a selection of upgrade cards allowing you to outfit your veterans with new weapons and gear, and all the tokens you need to add them to your Rebel armies!

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Tauntaun Riders Unit Expansion
Description:
The windswept plains of Hoth are treacherous even to native beasts, but tauntaun riders are trained to expertly handle their surefooted mounts, searching tirelessly for signs of the Empire. The tauntauns themselves can be quite dangerous, and few enemies wish to find themselves in the path of these ferocious snow lizards.

Within Tauntaun Riders Unit Expansion, you'll find two unique unpainted tauntaun rider miniatures to add to your Star Wars: Legion collection, enough for one support unit, along with a new unit card for you to field in battle. Your tauntaun's natural speed and defenses make them useful in a number of situations, and this pack also contains three upgrade cards that give you the freedom to find a role for them that fits your particular battle plan.

—description from the publisher

Name: 9-Bit Dungeon
Description:
9-Bit Dungeon is a 9 Card Print and Play Roguelike Solo Game, with a randomly generated dungeon with over 1500 possible layouts, retro artwork, four increasingly difficult levels, random enemies and events, and shops full of upgrades.

Each level of the dungeon is represented by four double sided cards, which are randomly flipped, rotated and shuffled to form a new dungeon each time. Each card has a 7x5 grid of tiles to explore, with floors, walls, water and lava, enemy spawn locations, treasure and keys to collect, entrances and exits, and shops to buy upgrades.

The goal is to complete all four levels, by defeating monsters, collecting the key and escaping each level in turn, and upgrading your abilities at the shop.

9-Bit Dungeon was created for the 2019 9 Card Game Print and Play Contest, and consists of 9 Cards and 18 other components, namely dice and cubes used to tracks statistics and represent Monsters in the Dungeon.

—description from the designer

Name: Poetica
Description:
In Poetica, players will compose poems using the illustrations of the Decktet as the source of inspiration for the nouns, verbs, and adjectives of a three-line poem.  Then, players will award style points to the other players.

First, you will receive six cards, arranged in a row. You must compose a line of poetry, using some aspect of the illustration from each card as the source for one word.  You may make free use of conjunctions, prepositions, article, pronouns, forms of "to be" and forms of "to have".  After your line is complete, players rotate seats; you will then write the second line of your poem in the same way with the new set of 6 cards now in front of you.  Players rotate seats one more time to write the third line of their poems, and then execute scoring.

You will distribute 5 points among your favorite poem(s), and then evaluate the 6-card row for which you did not compose a line, awarding 4 points among the players for the best line(s), and 1 point for the best use of each card.

The player who receives the most points has composed a poem for the ages!

—description from the designer

Name: Rumble Kings
Description:
Rumble Kings is a box of five minute fights that delivers a big punch. The game has a unique dice driven combat system and simple customization features offered through card drafting. During matches players compete by rolling dice, building attack sequences, and unleashing tactical combinations of punches, kicks and critical blows against their opponents. Each fighter has their very own signature ability and a limited amount of resources available during each match. Learning to maximize your dice rolls and understanding when to utilize your special abilities and Rumble cards is integral to victory. Throw too much, too quickly and your fighter may end up exhausted fighting an uphill battle!

—description from the publisher

Name: Karo Kick
Description:
Each player has 11 meeples. Movement is determined by a special die, which enables the following moves:

     1 forward
     2 forward
     3 forward
     1 to the right
     1 to the left
     1 backward


Each time a player gets into the opposite goal, it counts as a point. The player with the most points after a playing time of 30 minutes wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Emil und die Detektive
Description:
The goal of the game is to identify the thief. The players take turns drawing a card. The 24 cards give clues, put suspects on the board or send the pawns of the players to different areas of the game board, where they may question a witness (4) or exonerate a suspect (6). 
Each exonerated suspect counts 1 point. The player who identifies the thief gets 5 points.

The first player to get 10 points (if need be after several games) wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Familiar: Mythic Arena
Description:
Familiar is a tactical player vs player pet battling game! You and an opponent build decks with your choices of magically bonded Familiar companions, commonly called pets. Take turns putting those pets into one of 3 rows of the Arena, enhancing them with magical Elyth, and getting boosts from Rune and Item cards. The fastest pets go first in Battle and roll dice to see if damage is dealt. The first player to earn 3 Victory points wins!

The fantasy game world of Familiar takes place in the 12 realms of Elytha Tira. Those who live there are skilled in the use of a magical power source called Elyth. With it they can perform heroic feats, cast powerful spells, or tame fantastical beasts which can become their familiar companions, commonly called pets. The Mythic Arena is where you join in friendly battle competitions against your opponent’s familiars!

—description from the publisher

Name: Coloma: Deluxe Edition
Description:
Coloma: Deluxe Edition includes content not found in the retail edition. In addition to the base game components and stretch goals, this Kickstarter EXCLUSIVE version contains:

— 40 Poker Chips
— 30 custom Gold Nuggets
— 5 custom Score Markers
— 1 custom Round Marker
— 1 Metal First Player Marker
— 6 new Characters, each with a unique ability not found on characters from the base game, including:

Robber - You may spend 1 Wagon action (forgoing its usual movement Ability) to gain 3 Gold Nuggets from the Gold Cart (not the Gold Supply on the board!).

Homesteader - You may spend 1 Tent to build a Town Building card from your hand, paying the Saw cost on the card.

Renegade - Each time you add a Dude to your Graveyard, draw 3 cards.

Range Rider - Each time your Wagon moves over (or stops on) a vacant Horseshoe space on the Frontier Map, draw 1 card.

Maverick - Discard 1 card to gain either 1 Buck or 1 Dude.

Vigilante - Discard 1 used Barrel to place Dudes according to the usual rules.

[N.B. The custom components in the deluxe edition replace the standard components from the retail edition.]

Setting:
Coloma is the town where an unexpected event happened that shaped history of the Western Frontier. In the winter of 1848 a man building a sawmill on the South Fork of the American River spotted some bright nuggets in the tailrace waters below. Sure enough, it was gold! Though he tried to keep his discovery a secret, word spread quickly and it triggered the California Gold Rush of ‘49.

Thousands of people arrived from far and wide, making Coloma one of the fastest growing boomtowns in the country. Claims were staked, camps and makeshift homes were built, and hotels and saloons sprung up almost overnight. Everyone wanted their cut of the land’s wealth. For many it was Coloma or Bust!

In the game of Coloma, you are a pioneer who has recently travelled out West to strike it rich and make a name for yourself. You will prospect for gold and use your windfalls to recruit workers, rustle up horses, and establish businesses. You will also get opportunities to explore the surrounding riverways and frontier lands. But alas! You are not alone—every other pioneer seems to have gotten the same idea! Therefore, it will take extra cunning tactics on your part to not go Bust with the rest of them...

Overview of Play:
At the beginning of each chapter, you and the other players will simultaneously select an action to perform on the board. Once your selections are revealed, you must check if a majority of players chose the same action. If so, it is a Bust—which disables the Boom bonus that would be included otherwise. Then the players take turns performing actions, such as gaining resources, moving wagons on the map, building bridges and businesses, and placing camps and gunmen. After that, a section of the board is rotated—slightly changing the layout of the actions for the upcoming chapter.

When the rotating section hits high noon, the round ends with a bang: a shootout against an ever-growing number of outlaws! If you and the other players can outnumber the outlaws with your combined gunmen, you will get your fair share of the rewards. But if not, the rewards drop, and some of the gunmen will go to the graveyard... The game ends after the third shootout, and the player with the most points wins!

Coloma is a fast moving game with many paths to victory. It offers unique twists on simultaneous action selection, resource management, and engine-building. The town cards in your tableau allow you to play more efficiently, gain extra actions, and bend the rules to your advantage. With these cards and the bridge tiles (which add points based on what you achieve), you can create the perfect combination for your strategy and play style.

— description from the publisher

Name: Quartermaster: Apply Within
Description:
Like all good spy legends, this one starts with a bang… originating from the Quartermaster’s lab whilst he was tinkering with experimental shoe polish. He leaves behind nothing but a decimated lab, a pair of ash-covered, blastresistant shoes, and a job opening... for Quartermaster.

Now, a team of auditors are cracking down over concerns of health and safety within the facility and are systematically restricting access to each lab. You and the other Quarternovices must scramble to use the blueprints that survived the blast to create the best spy gadget, and win the promotion to Quartermaster!
Applicants beware - with stakes this high, no-one is above sabotage.

Quartermaster: Apply Within is a 10 - 20 minute compact, inventive and ruthless game built around worker-placement and pattern-making. Each turn sees 1-4 players (or Quaternovices) scramble to collect the parts needed to build incredible spy gadgets, while protecting their prototypes against sabotage from devious co-workers.

With a setup influenced by both player choice and chance, and the option to replace up to three players with an AI, Quartermaster: Apply Within is flexible, dynamic, and addictively replayable.

—description from the publisher

Name: UNO: Monster High
Description:
Monster High UNO Card Game:


     The classic game of UNO gets a new twist with the Monster High edition.



     It's the original UNO card game featuring favorite Monster High characters and scenes.



     Plus, there's a new special rule: the Creeperific “Urrrhhh” card allows the player to channel his or her inner zombie and give away some of those frightful cards! It's Fast Fun For Everyone!



     Includes 112 cards and instructions. 


—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: UNO: Monster High
Description:
Easy to pick up... Impossible to put down!


     Same great UNO plus the EXCLUSIVE Skull* card and play! (*Blocks a "Draw 4" card)



     112 Custom Cards Featuring Monster High.



     And do not forget to yell UNO when you only have one card left!


—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: UNO: Monster High
Description:
The original game of UNO gets a spook-tastic Monster High twist!


     Classic UNO rules apply, and the addition of a special rule and 4 extra cards gives players a chance to experience all new game changing moments!



     When you play a Beast Ghoul Friends Card, you get to choose a color and then discard up to three frightful cards from your hand. Plus, pick another player who gets to discard one card of that color, too!



     Fans of the series will recognize their favorite Monster High characters and scenes featured on the cards they play.



     And do not forget to yell UNO when you only have one card left!



     Includes 112 cards and instructions.


—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Ambal Tournament: Foundation
Description:
Ambal Tournament is a Card Game with simultaneous rounds, meaning each player puts their skills face down and reveals them at the same time. Deck construction and deck building allows deep customization using up to two Schools of Knowledge, each representing an area of knowledge with their own set of cards and style of play.
Ambal Tournament | Foundation is the first set released, containing 100 cards. Duels can be 1vs1 or 2vs2 and each card is a skill, varying from Actions (physically inclined), Spells (magically inclined) or Abilities.

Welcome to the Ambal Tournament! Participants from the spiritual land of Ambal gather in this friendly competition, promoting the development of knowledge and combat techniques. If the past taught anything to the human capitals, was that they should be prepared to defend themselves from the powerful spirits living in this world. Master the great Schools of Knowledge and their unique powers, competing in diverse and exciting duels to earn a spot amongst the elite group of fighters ready to defend Ambal.

—description from the designer

Name: Dein letzter Coup
Description:
You and three friends slip into the roles of the four characters for one evening, solve the tricky puzzles together, find the perpetrator among you, solve the murder and spend an exciting and funny evening with Your last coup.

Background
Slowly your heart rate decreases, your adrenaline level returns to normal and your hands stop shaking. You and four accomplices are celebrating your successful bank robbery. You are happy about a loot of 1.1 million euros and let the corks pop in your secret quarters. But shortly after the party ends, Anna, your make-up artist, is found murdered and you are arrested. Does the murder have anything to do with the bank robbery? How well do you really know your accomplices? Unravel the secrets of the other players and find the murderer.

—description from the publisher

Name: Krimi total: Der Hanf des Verderbens
Description:
The '60s are coming to an end. You are part of a happy hippie community and looking for self-realization – free love and marijuana consumption included!

You are the only inhabitants of this idyllic little island in the middle of a lonely lake. Your commune feeds itself largely self-sufficiently – thanks to the fruit and vegetable production and the multitude of free-range happy animals. Your hemp plantation provides a relaxed atmosphere and a financial boost. Three weeks ago you harvested them together. So spiritual enlightenment is assured!

Tonight at your celebration in honour of the moon god Chandra you will finally test the new harvest – it's high time, because the old stocks are completely used up! But even before you could open your festival with the ritual moon salute, you've found Uschi dead on the harvested plantation! What had happened?

—description from the publisher

Name: Ardillas del Bosque
Description:
Ardillas del Bosque ("Chipmunks") is a family game in which each player represents a squirrel that will first hide its fruits in the forest (in addition to its "traps") and then pick them up, trying to steal the fruits of other neighboring squirrels.

The game consists of a very innovative modular board adaptable to the number of players, as well as fruit set by squirrels.

During the turn a player will first place his fruits and trap on the board, and later once all the fruits are placed and "hidden" they begin to steal one by one. The mechanics of the game combines set collection and memory.

Also in the board different animals are represented (one face day animals and the other side night animals) which perform actions that will help or hinder the tasks of the squirrel players.

The one who gets the best combination of fruits will win at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher

Ardillas del bosque es un juego familiar donde cada jugador representa a una ardilla que primero esconderá sus frutos en el bosque (además de sus "trampas") y después las recogerá, intentando robar los frutos de otras ardillas vecinas.

El juego consta de un tablero modular muy innovador adaptable al número de jugadores, así como conjuntos de frutos por ardillas.

Durante el turno un jugador primero colocará sus frutos y trampa en el tablero y, posteriormente - una vez que todos los frutos están colocados y "escondidos" -, se empiezan a robar uno a uno. La mecánica del juego combina, «set collection» y «memory».

Además en el tablero vienen representados diferentes animales (una cara animales de día y en la otra cara animales de noche) los cuales realizan unas acciones que ayudarán o dificultarán las tareas de las ardillas jugadoras.

Ganará aquel que consiga mejor combinación de frutos al final del juego.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: Unicorn Rescue Society: The Card Game
Description:
Join the Unicorn Rescue Society in its mission to protect the world’s legendary animals from danger!

The Unicorn Rescue Society Card Game is a fast-paced, easy-to-learn game for 2-8 people that takes about 10 minutes to play. Race to rescue mythical creatures by matching them to their native habitats. Score big points by finding homes for the rarest creatures.

Each player begins the game with five cards, which are a mix of creatures and habitats. Using the cards in their hand and three face-up cards on the table, players take turns rescuing creatures by matching them to their native habitats, scoring points based on the value of the creature. If a player can't make a match, they draw a card. The game ends when a player has no cards left in their hand. The player with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monster
Description:
Monster is a gambling game in which the best
hand must defeat the Monster, a hand made
from everyone’s discards.

Equipment: 
A Pairs deck.  A button for indicating the
dealer, and chips for keeping score.

To Begin: 
   Start by paying an ante into the pot. If you have 4 or 5 players, the ante is 2 chips. With 6 to 8 players, the ante is 1 chip.  
   Shuffle the deck and deal a hand of six cards to each player. The player on the dealer’s left will act first. (Move the dealer button only after a full game, i.e., after the pot clears.)
   Each player acts once, in turn. On your turn, you may discard zero to three cards, or fold. You are not allowed to keep a hand that includes a pair; if this is your only choice, you must fold.  You may want to fold some other hands as well,
depending on circumstances
   Your discards go facedown into a pile in the middle, which becomes the Monster’s hand. Folded cards do not go to the Monster; they go completely out of play. Note: This is not draw poker. Your discarded cards are not replaced!

The Showdown: 
After each player on the next page) becomes the “Champion,” and
must compare hands with the Monster. When the Champion faces the Monster,he must defeat it in order to take the pot. The
Monster wins ties.

If the Champion loses (or ties), he pays 5 chips to the pot and is knocked out of the game.

Definition of High Hand: 
Any player hand that contains a pair is a losing hand, and
can’t be kept for the showdown. All hands in the showdown will be compared by highest card, then second highest card, and so on. The best player hand is 10-9-8-7-6-5. A card is better than nothing, so a hand of 10-8-7-4 is better than 10-8-7.  This is similar to comparing poker hands for high card, except that there is no limit on the number of cards that can play. The Monster uses the same rules, but it ignores duplicate cards. Treat the Monster as if it had only one card of each rank.

Winning: 
To win the pot, you must become the Champion and defeat the monster. If no one wins, play another round with only the
surviving players. Players who folded, or who lost a fight with the Monster, are out. All cards are reshuffled in the next round
(the Monster does not keep its cards).

Oddities: If one player is left, he automatically wins. If zero players are left, either because they all had to fold, or because the last player couldn’t defeat his own discards, then play again with the same players who started the round.

Ties: 
If two Champions win with exactly the same hand, they split the pot. If two Champions have the same hand but lose to the Monster, they must each drop out and pay the 5 chip penalty, unless they are the only two players remaining, in which case they pay 5 chips but play another round.

Strategy: In the first few rounds, you may want to “duck,” playing low hands and trying not to become the Champion. As players leave the game, it becomes easier to defeat the Monster, because it is getting fewer cards.

Name: SLASHR
Description:
The Slasher Movie can be scary, ridiculous, gory, trashy, witty social commentary or just dumb fun.  SLASHR is a fast playing, free wheeling Slasher Movie emulator captured in 9 simple playing cards.

Before starting play, make sure that you set the rating for this movie (a PG-13 game is very different than the Hard R version).  If we are okay with our movie getting a hard R Rating, make sure that the players are all comfortable with that.  You may want to check out some standard RPG safety mechanics - such as an X-CARD.

Have everyone sit around a circle.  Take your SLASHR deck, shuffle it, and put it in the middle of the area you are playing, in easy reach for all the players.  If you really want to get in the mood, service some greasy popcorn, turn the lights down and sing "Let's All Go to the Lobby".

As a group, come up with a setting for a 1980s-style exploitation flick.  Once you have a setting, settle on a title for the film.  The setting and title are going to really lock down what the players do over the course of the movie.

The first player is the last person to have seen a horror movie.  They begin the game by introducing themselves (their actual self) as starring as a character in the movie.  So, for instance, let's say that we are playing a movie called Unholy Pigskin (a PG-13 slasher about a High School Football team full of vampires.  You would say something like, "Starring Chris O'Neill as Head Coach N. Romancer". Then have the next player in the circule introduce themselves and so on, until everyone has been introduced.

Each player will then take a turn creating a scene in the Movie.  The most important thing to remember is that you are SETTING UP A SCENE - not resolving it.  To properly set up a scene, it should involve your character, at least one other character, and a location. These two players should both want something, or need an answer to a question.  This simple mechanic should drive us immediately into action.  "Okay, so the Cheerleader and I are having a fight in the parking lot about leaving town."

When the scene starts, the players can start role-playing their characters, or narrating activity in the scene.  Anyone that is not directly involved in the scene acts as additional "uncredited" characters and background effects.

When one of the following happens, ANY PLAYER should yell CUT!

     A Character is about to get the thing they want.
     A Character is about to get the answer to a question.
     Anything stupid, weird, or dangerous occurs.
     Things are getting slow or boring in any way.


Whenever someone yells CUT! the active player takes the SLASHR deck, cuts it, and flips over the top card.  Depending on the card, the scene is then resolved in a specific way.  After resolving the scene, shuffle the deck and play passes to the next player clockwise.

FEAR, LUST, LIES, GREED, or STUPIDITY(THE RED CARDS) If the player cuts to a RED CARD, they resolve the scene in their favor using the prompt on the card, then return that card to the deck.

MURDERED (BLACK CARDS)
When you pull a BLACK CARD, you got Murdered.  In the game, this means that this scene - no matter what it was about - ends in your grisly murder at the hands of the SLASHR KILLR.  Only the ACTIVE PLAYER dies, and they always get to narrate their own death!  If the Slasher has not been revealed yet, the death should be laden with mystery.

When you die, you flip over the remaining cards in the SLASHR deck and take one of the 5 RED CARDS out (Fear, Lust, Lies, Greed, and Stupidity) and plays it face up in front of them.

When your character has been eliminated, you are still playing.  If it becomes your turn again, instead of setting up a scene with your character - you set up and narrate a quick scene using your prompt as inspiration.  You are encouraged to be the unnamed people in the other player's scenes in the movie, to add narration, to make sound effects, and to shout encouragement from your theater seats.

Don't forget to put the BLACK CARD back into the deck.

DON'T TURN AROUND
If the player cuts to DON'T TURN AROUND, they have a brush with Death, but don't die.  Early on in the game, when this happens - the player should narrate their "jump scare" or "cheap heat" moment - cats jumping out, car crashes, kids pretending to be the murderer, etc.

After the SLASHR is in play, this card should always result in a near death experience with the SLASHR KILLR.  Put the card back in the deck.

SLASHR
When you flip the SLASHR card - you are the SLASHR.  You should resolve the scene as the SLASHR, revealing your identity and motive.  You get to resolve the scene in your favor - but as your can only die when you are the active player, your opponent in the scene does not get killed.

YOUR INEVITABLE GRISLY DEATH
As you play, you will be removing cards form the deck, and making it MORE LIKELY that the next player is going to die. With either (a) the deck runs out of RED Cards, or (b) there is only the SLASHR. and one other person alive; the game ends.  Each player that was eliminated during the game gets a chance to "pitch" the ending of the movie to the remaining player(s).  The ending should involved the survivors defeating the SLASHR or getting away.  Afterwards, the SLASHRget to add a "sequel clause" scene where they show how they actually survived for the next movie.

Name: Super Wash
Description:
Superhero siblings Hanno and Fantastic Fiona are ready to save the world once again...or are they? Their superhero clothes need to be washed and dried first, and the evil Dr. Cloud has vowed to throw a spanner in the works.

In Super Wash, players take turns in the role of one of the siblings and Dr. Cloud. Whoever hangs up the most laundry wins!

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Santa Satan
Description: Promo special resource card and new milestone that were included with the Christmas's Pinup Santa Satan, which is not part of the game.

Name: Mage Knight Board Game: Dual Color Cards Expansion
Description:
5 promo cards for Mage Knight Board Game, first released as part of the Mage Knight: Ultimate Edition, later sold separately through WizKids online store.

4 cards are Advanced Action cards, which can be charged with 2 different colours, the last card being an artefact.

Four of the cards are dual colored:
Explosive Bolt
Chilling Stare
Rush of Adrenaline
Power of Crystals

Each of these cards allow you to spend either type of mana shown on the card in order to play them or activate their stronger effect. They also count as both colors for certain effects.

The fifth card is a new artifact, the Mysterious Box.

Name: The "Promised Land" Game
Description: Players use a spinner to race from the Starting Line to the Finish Line, navigating a board filled with obstacles -- such as "Philistines Massing for Attack! Move Back 4 Spaces" and "Lay Siege to Gat, Miss 1 Turn" -- and rewards -- such as "Capture Ashkelon, Advance 5 Spaces" and "Attack Canaanite War Camp, Advance 2 Spaces."

Name: Redcoats in the Wilderness
Description:
We’ve spent the past ten years working on a new revised and updated ruleset based on our original “Wilderness Wars” tabletop miniatures rules system.  This new edition is equally playable in 15mm or 25mm scales, with both US Standard and Metric measurement player aids included.

Usable with most 18th Century French and Indian Wars Wilderness scenarios

Fast. Fun. Furious.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cnossos
Description:
King Minos has locked you in his labyrinth to serve as food to the Minotaur. You must collect cristal fragments to kill the creature and unlock the maze’s exit.
You get fragments by flipping the maze’s tiles or by stealing them from the other players during fights.

Name: Space Base: Command Station
Description:
Following the events surrounding "Shy Pluto," two new zones within known space have opened up. The Admiral has promoted two new Captains to the rank of Commodore to command these new space bases and work their sectors!

The Space Base: Command Station expansion allows players to expand their games of Space Base to include two more players and adds "pre-deployed" ship cards to adjust for balance and gameplay with more than five players. Now six or seven Commodores can compete for the promotion to become the Admiral of the U.E.S. Fleet!

The Space Base: Command Station box is designed to be large enough to hold the Space Base base game, the Shy Pluto expansion, and additional future expansions in one convenient storage box!

—description from the publisher

Name: Kosom Kusam
Description:
From the Mayan dialect Kosom Kusam that means swallow, this game is about the conquest that the Spaniards made to Mexico, and about the first place they ARRIVED in our country, that is, the island of COZUMEL, in the Mexican state of QUINTANA ROO , which means place of swallows, and in the game, the two players will represent, one to the Spaniards, and the other to the Mayans, and they will have to eliminate the opponent by shifting their chips horizontally or vertically, until they manage to enclose those of the opposing player , or, when one of the players has managed to reach one of the represented corners, like the island, or on the contrary, represented as the sea of the Atlantic, at that moment will be taken for conquest.

—description from the publisher

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – At the Gates
Description:
At the Gates is the first Chapter Pack in the King's Landing cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game.

Featuring three copies each of twenty distinct cards, this Chapter Pack marks the beginning of the sixth cycle of Chapter Packs for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. The King’s Landing cycle takes a new approach to the Game of Thrones LCG. Rather than following the plot of A Song of Ice and Fire, this cycle is centered around the capital of Westeros, allowing you to explore the world of Westeros more freely than ever before.

Your journey begins at the great wall that surrounds the capital city. Aegon I Targaryen had seven gates built as the entrances to his grand metropolis in honor or the number sacred to the Faith of the Seven. Now in At the Gates, the great Houses of Westeros gain access to these blessed locations. Each gate is a low-cost location that can provide you with income from their tolls and the chance to sacrifice them in exchange for two draws if you embrace the spirit of your chosen House. Additionally, this Chapter Pack features new versions of beloved characters, embracing the plots and deadly intrigues of A Song of Ice and Fire with the continuation of the shadow keyword, first reintroduced in the Dance of Shadows cycle.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Star Wars: Legion – TX-225 GAVw Occupier Combat Assault Tank Unit Expansion
Description:
For the Galactic Empire, conquering a planet is only the beginning of the battle. Massive vehicles like AT-STs and elite shock troops like Imperial Death Troopers may be effective at sweeping across battlefields and capturing new territory, but they rarely stick around to hold this ground. Soon, however, you'll gain a powerful tool that can help quell any opposition that might rise against Imperial occupation.

With the TX-225 GAVw Occupier Combat Assault Tank Unit Expansion, you'll find a single  menacing TX-225 miniature that can work in tandem with your ground troops to impose the Empire's will wherever it's been assigned. This beautiful miniature is accompanied by the full assortment of unit cards, upgrade cards, and tokens that you'll need to add one to your Imperial armies.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Legion – X-34 Landspeeder Unit Expansion
Description:
Unable to match the Empire's production of military equipment, the Rebel Alliance makes do with whatever they have on hand — which often means converting civilian vehicles into weapons of war. Soon, you'll be able to adapt one of the Star Wars saga's most iconic speeders to fit your needs on the battlefields of the Galactic Civil War.

Already a speedy craft thanks to its powerful repulsor engine, an X-34 Landspeeder becomes a threat to even the toughest Imperial opponents when driven by an experienced pilot and equipped with an assortment of weapons. The X-34 Landspeeder Unit Expansion adds one X-34 landspeeder miniature — complete with two unique weapon options — to your Rebel armies. Along with the miniature, you'll also find a unit card and all the tokens you need to get your X-34 up and running as well as an array of upgrade cards to customize it to your specific battle plans.

—description from the publisher

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – City of Secrets
Description:
Explore the twisting alleys of the capital of Westeros in City of Secrets, the second Chapter Pack in the King's Landing cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game!

As the sixth cycle of A Game of Thrones: The Card Game continues, you leave the plot of A Song of Ice and Fire behind to freely explore the world of Westeros. Shadows haunt the streets, closing in from the North, the East, and the South, and dark prophecies speak of terrors just on the horizon. Perhaps the time of great Houses and powers has passed.

Those who do not fight for a king or queen find a new agenda that can allow them to join the brotherhood without banners in the hollow hill. This Chapter Pack also continues to develop the shadow keyword, allowing your battles for the Iron Throne to take on an added level of intrigue with shadowy new events to give you the edge by embracing the true nature of your faction.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Moravian Sun
Description:
"Moravian Sun" is a two player napoleonic-era wargame at brigade level. It's designed by Enrico Acerbi, using the Vive la France: Empire rules system, in the ideal prosecution of two already published games, Masséna at Loano and Wise Bayonets. It covers the masterpiece battle fought and won by Napoleon against the hopes of the III Coalition. At the sunset of December 2nd, 1805, the map of Europe was redrawn for many years to come, and the art of war had a new master.

The map (scale 1:30.000) depicts the famous zone around the Pratzen heights. Each hex covers approximately 450-500 meters. Each turn represents 1 hour of real time. The counters represent 500/600 infantry for each strength point, or 75/150 cavalry men.

Medium/low complexity, playable in solitaire.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: SNAGGIT: The  Speed Reaction Card Game with a Whisker of Bluff
Description:
SNAGGIT is a speed reaction game with a whisker of bluff.

SNAG (verb) to catch, grab or seize quickly.
Can you be the quickest to snag as many cards as possible before the game ends. Cards have a unique animal picture, a movement icon (one of 5) and a habitat icon. In each turn there is a challenge. For match challenges you use the icons to snag cards that are the same as or different to habitat or movement. In call out challenges you need to be quick witted. Shout out as you snag cards with the 'biggest', 'quickest' or 'strongest' attributes. This is not just about size or speed but anything that is correct. So a scorpion has the strongest poison compared to a cow, horse, dragonfly and snail.

SNAGGIT is quick, easy and socially interactive for all ages.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dragon Castle: La Fortezza di Moongha
Description:
Originally available at "Modena Play 2019", as a promo.

A new castle layout.

—user summary

Name: Tex: vapori indiani promo card
Description:
A promo card for the Game.

It is a generic action, which reads: "all other players discard 2 action cards"

—user summary

Name: Arena: A Tavern Game Played with Dice and Cards
Description:
Looking for an alternative to three-dragon ante? Arena is an easy to learn dice and cards game where players select terrible monsters and force them to face off against one another for gold and glory!
—description from the publisher

Arena is published as a print-and-play game requiring each player to have three standard dice.  The document includes thirty-six card images.

Arena fancifully is presented as a game that adventurers might play in the taverns of Forgotten Realms.

Players receive four coins (betting tokens), three dice, and are dealt four cards.  Each card denotes a "monster" that can be played into the Arena.

Play proceeds in rounds.  In each round, each player selects a card from their hand and plays it face-down on the table; all cards are revealed simultaneously.

Each "monster" has a specified number of dice (one to three) and players roll the appropriate number of dice to resolve the round - the high result wins, and ties are resolved by re-rolling.

The winning player selects one other player as the round loser.  The loser moves a coin (betting token) into the stakes and discards the losing card.  All other players return their played card to their hand.

Play proceeds until one player runs out of cards (and coins).  At this point the game winner is determined by the player holding the highest number of cards, and ties are resolved by summing the dice value of the held cards; if a tie still exists the players roll dice to determine a winner.  The winner claims the stakes.

—user summary

Name: Welcome to Iceburgh
Description:
Mayor Snowflake has asked for help build up the town of ICEBURGH for the big winter sports expo planned next year! Luckily, some local friends can help!

Mr. Fox-It, Po & Lars Construction, Hoof's Roofs and The Iceburgh Sealers are ready to use their savvy building skills to turn ice and wood into new buildings to improve the town and show off the ICEBURGH to the world!

Welcome to Iceburgh is a 2-4 player resource management game where players gain water, wood and coins to upgrade buildings in the town of Iceburgh for victory points.

The game is made up of 15 iceberg tiles that are put into a 4 x 4 grid with 1 space left open.  A boat tile goes in that empty space and each player puts one of their work meeple onto the boat.

Over 12 rounds players will rotate as first player which allows them to move the boat either horizontally or vertically along the grid, shifting the icebergs when them move the boat.

Each iceberg has an action that a player can choose to take to help them gain or convert their resources as needed.  If a player has enough resources they may upgrade one of the current buildings on the icebergs to gain points. They do this on their turn by choosing the upgrade action or by upgrading a building adjacent to the boat by paying the appropriate cost (combination of water, wood and coins). Then the player will flip that iceberg over to show the upgraded building and new actions available.

The winner is the player at the end of 12 rounds with the most victory points and they will get the KEY TO ICEBURGH!
â€‹
—description from the publisher

Name: Dungeonology: Circe's Bay
Description:
On Mount Circeo, which overlooks the beautiful Mediterranean Sea, stands an imposing and mysterious palace.
Since it is surrounded by a Mediterranean Maquis forest, arriving at the palace seems almost impossible, as if the forest plants themselves are moving to create everchanging paths to confuse and divert unwanted guests. But if you come from the sea and traverse the white beach below the promontory, where mysterious sea creatures are said to gather, the rumors say that a Passage to the fabulous mansion can be found.
It is time to put into practice your experience as explorers, to unveil the secrets of Mount Circeo and enter the palace and find out if the legends that say it is still inhabited by the mysterious sorceress Circe and her servants are true. Be careful, Scholars, because if you encounter the sorceress, you will have to resist her devious spells, capable of turning her enemies into servant animals for all eternity!

You are the ideal candidates for this job, so get going, and do not disappoint the expectations of Rocca Civetta. Set on the slopes of Mount Circeo, this Dungeonology expansion will lead you to unveil the secrets of the immortal sorceress Circe. You are going to face a thousand dangers: the sorceress will try to turn you into one of her sevant animals, her servants themselves will jealously guard the secrets of Circeo, the Leonine Guards of the palace will always be on your trail, and, if you aren't carefull, you may find yourself facing Circe's terrible pet Kraken!

—description from the publisher

Name: LABYRINTHIA
Description: Finally, there is the popular game of skill from the "Super Toy Club" for home! With a lot of team spirit and good communication, the players have to roll the ball from start to finish. Each player is responsible for one corner of the three-dimensional game board and only together can the goal be achieved. For this skill and concentration is required, because otherwise, the ball falls into one of the numerous holes. If that happens the team has to start again. But watch out, time is running fast and the other team is just waiting for their chance. In Labyrinthia, two teams play against each other. The team that works smarter and works better together will win in the end. Stops the time and challenges the opposing team: which team is faster?

Name: Adventure Island: Santa Claus
Description:
A promo character for Adventure Island given out to Pegasus Supporters for Christmas 2018.

His stats are 3, 2, 3 but he lets everyone in his location roll 1 extra die for an action.

Name: Serengeti
Description:
Serengeti is a fast-paced, cooperative board game packed with unique mechanics and beautifully designed artwork.  Players traverse treacherous terrain and navigate expansive grasslands in order to rescue endangered safari animals from the snare of trespassing poachers. Each player will take on the role of a reservation official. While on duty, these officials will take actions to save animals and arrest poachers. Players will have to evade stampedes, harsh weather, and poacher traps, but don't worry you will be given equipment to assist you in your efforts.

—description from the publisher

Name: Scions of Avermhir
Description: Scions of Avermhir (aver meer) is a new type of tactical strategy game that rewards thought out plans and maneuvers, without taking several hours to play! With a diverse set of goals to achieve and enhancements to acquire, you'll find that every game feels new and fun! The game welcomes new players and old hands alike, with each game ending down to the wire, not giving either player a chance to snowball out of control.

Name: Monterey-Opoly
Description:
HOW DO YOU MAKE A GAME ABOUT THE GREAT CITY OF MONTEREY, CALIFORNIA? While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Monterey we could into this box. It’s full of outdoor adventures, family attractions, rich traditions and of course...one incredible bay - a little something for everyone! Looking for a fun way to experience California’s rugged coast?

HERE’S A QUICK IDEA OF HOW TO PLAY! Buy your favorite Monterey properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! GET YOUR GAME ON!

So choose your token and advance to GO MONTEREY! You may soon be the Mayor… or out of the game for eating too many short rib grilled cheeses from The Cannery Row Brewing Company! THIS IS MONTEREY.... AND IT’S YOUR ROLL!

—description from the publisher

Name: Tallahassee-Opoly
Description:
HOW DO YOU MAKE A GAME ABOUT THE GREAT CITY OF TALLAHASEE, FLORIDA? While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Tallahassee we could into this box. It’s full of outdoor adventures, canopy roads, deep-rooted culture, and of course…a whole lotta college spirit - a little something for every Tallahasseean! Looking for a fun way to experience Florida's Capital City?

HERE’S A QUICK IDEA OF HOW TO PLAY! Buy your favorite Tallahassee properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and the IRS and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! GET YOUR GAME ON!

Choose your token and advance to GO Tallahassee!You may soon be the Mayor… or out of the game for eating too many jumbo corndogs at Dog Et Al! THIS IS TALLAHASSEE.... AND IT’S YOUR ROLL!

—description from the publisher

Name: Between Two Castles of Mad King Ludwig: Bonus Card Promo Pack #1
Description:
Originally available as part of the Tantrum House Season 6 Kickstarter campaign.
Also available from Spielbox #1 2020
Also in the Secrets & Soirees Expansion  included.

A new 4 pack of Utility Cards.
Families: Game: Between Two Castles of Mad King Ludwig
Game: Castles of Mad King Ludwig

Name: Mint Works: Tantrum House Intern Promo Card
Description:
A single promo card. Location on one side and AI on the other side.

Originally available as part of the Tantrum House Season 6 Kickstarter campaign, under the name "Dan the Intern/House of Tantrum".

Later available unbranded under the name "David the Intern/Work Study" as part of the Kickstarter campaigns of other games in the  Mint series.

Name: Pocket Quiz: Gehirnjogging (2019 edition)
Description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with mental exercises. The backside of each card contains the solutions.

Solve the exercises first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Pocket Quiz: Schlager
Description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information.

The title translates to "schlager music" and the questions are about that topic.

—user summary

Name: Pocket Quiz: Querdenken (2019 edition)
Description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "lateral thinking" and the questions are about that topic.

—user summary

Name: Pocket Quiz: Serienjunkies
Description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information.

The title translates to "series junkies" and the questions are about that topic.

—user summary

Name: Pocket Quiz: Globetrotter
Description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information.

The title translates to "globetrotter" and the questions are about that topic.

—user summary

Name: Pocket Quiz: Allgemeinwissen (2019 edition)
Description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information.

The title translates to "General Knowledge".

—user summary

Name: Lunes: Recorte de Personal
Description:
The boss has fired several employees and you will be doing extra hours. Unclogging the toilet is just one of these jobs, so let's see how we can take advantage of it.

This expansion for Lunes includes new reward objects, as well as a new competitive mod for 2 players on a single board.

—description from the publisher

Recorte de personal en la oficina: han echado a varios empleados y estaremos realizando trabajos que no nos corresponden. Destapar el baño es sólo uno de ellos, pero vamos a ver cómo le podremos sacar provecho.

Una expansión de Lunes que incluye nuevos objetos recompensa, además de una nueva modalidad competitiva para 2 jugadores en un solo tablero.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

Name: Michael Schumacher Formel 1
Description:
Each player receives a Finish card at the beginning of the game and tries to reach the race cars via tactical use of the dice. The race covers three laps. 
The player's Finish card shows in what order that player needs the cars to finish. For each correctly entered car, the player receives the specified score. The player with the highest score has won the game. If it's your turn, roll all four dice and distribute the numbers randomly to the participating cars, trying to achieve the result shown on your Finish card.

—user summary

Name: HexaGol
Description:
A football game for 2 players, where each hexagon is a player of a team. The objective of the game is to score goals using your cunning and strategy.

This is a fast-paced game, pocket-sized, ideal in any occasion and playable in almost any environment.

The game contains 20 hexagons, 10 for each team in blue and red, and 1 wooden token representing the ball. Each character has special abilities, conditioning the way they move, or the way they are allowed to move the ball.

Some characters are able to move the ball long distances, others may jump above other players, there's even the option to climb on top of other players.. Come on ref! That's got to be a foul!


Es un juego de futbol para dos personas donde cada hexágono es un jugador del equipo. El objetivo es hacerle goles a tu contrincante con estrategias a corto plazo.

El juego es rapido, y pequeño (tamaño bolsillo) ideal para llevarlo a cualquier tipo de ocasión y jugar en espacios muy reducidos.

El juego consta de 20 Hexágonos, 10 del equipo azul y 10 del equipo rojo, y una ficha de madera que representará la pelota. Cada uno de los personajes tiene habilidades distintas, ya sea en la forma que se mueve el personaje (ósea el hexágono) o la forma en que mueven la pelota (la ficha).

Algunos tendrán la posibilidad de lanzar la pelota a distancia, otros saltar por encima de los demás jugadores, e incluso hay uno que tiene la opción de subirse encima de los otros jugadores para quitarles la pelota - "Eso es full referí!!".

Name: Death Rabbits
Description:
In Death Rabbits you fight against other clans of mutant rabbits, in Battle Royale style, with the goal to destroy them and conquer the post-apocalyptic world!

Death Rabbits draws influence from old style turn-based artillery games such as Scorched Earth and Worms, incorporating move, attack and defend mechanisms along with concepts such as Range, Line of Sight and Area of Effect.

The game is played on a landscape made up of 6, out of 8 tiles, randomly selected.  The Rabbits then move across the landscape trying to kill each other, whilst defending themselves against incoming attacks from other clans.

Players must manage their arsenal of Explodey, Stabby and Shooty weapons to inflict the maximum damage on their rival clans.  But, they must be aware of their opponents' weapons and build their defences appropriately.

Death Rabbits also contains 5 Booster cards which come into play later in the game, giving the clans additional powers that enhance their attack, defence or movement abilities.

The last clan with Rabbits alive rules the world!

—description from the designer

Name: From the Cellar: Pack 9
Description:
From the Cellar: Pack 9 is an Advanced Squad Lead scenario pack released by Le Franc Tireur in 2019. It’s a peculiar product, collecting scenarios from the French Vae Victis magazine, seven other original scenario designs, as well as a small booklet with some personal notes, two articles and a comic.

From the Cellar: Pack 9 also comes with the Italian nationality chart, which should originally have been published with Le Franc Tireur #14: Italians[/thing]. On the back of this chart is an original map with OB information, on which the reader may track an AAR printed as one of the articles. The article is the creative AAR of a game where only twos and sevens are rolled. The other article is a story about a Ukrainian unit that was well researched.

The scenarios are:

FT273: Former Foes: Xuan Loc, Northeast of Saigon, Indochina, 29 October 1945: Viet Minh versus Indian Infantry and Elements of the IJA Southern Expedition Army: Designed by Jean-Pascal Paoli
FT272: Rise of the Viet Minh: Dong Mu, Indochina, 10 April 1945: Viet Minh versus French: Designed by Laurent Closier
FT271: The Lock of Colmar: Kayserberg, France, 18 December 1944: Americans and Foreign Legion versus Germans: Designed by Lionel Colin
FT270: Revenges at Saint-Julien: Saint-Julien, France, 9 August 1944: French Partisans versus Germans
FT269: End of the Rope: Stanly Mound, Hong-Kong, 23 December 1941: Japanese versus Commonwealth: Designed by Philippe Naud
FT268: Spain’s Crusaders: Sitno, Russia, 23 October 1941: Spanish Azul versus Russians
FT267: Thugny-Trugny: Thugny-Trugny, France, 9 June 1940: French versus Germans: Designed by Jim Suderman
FT266 (VV75): A Fine Mess: Pommereuil, France, 18 May 1940: German versus French: Designed by Philippe Naud
FT265 (VV73): Balkan-Kessel: Bolec, Serbia, 17 October 1944: Germans versus Partisans and Russians: Designed by Philippe Naud
FT264 (VV62): Hand off the Loot: Near Paulhac, France, 2 June 1944: French Partisans versus Germans: Designed by Philippe Naud
FT263 (VV55): Summer Duty: Near Kalinovka, Russia, 31 July 1943: Russians versus Germans: Designed by Philippe Naud
FT262 (VV41): 20 Years Later: Berensdorf, Germany, 8 September 1939: Germans versus French: Designed by Philippe Naud
FT261 (VV37): Algiers, Algeria, 8 November 1942: Americans versus French: Designed by Philippe Naud
FT260 (VV31): Inainte: Filiberta, Russia, 26 September 1941: Russians versus Romanians: Designed by Philippe Naud
FT259 (VV21): Wisnicz, Poland, 6 September 1939: Polish versus Germans: Designed by Philippe Naud
FT258 (VV20): Near Burbulatovo, Russia, 25 February 1943: Russians versus Germans: Designed by Philippe Naud
FT257 (VV10): Gafsa, Tunisia, 21 November 1942: Germans versus French: Designed by Philippe Naud

Name: Zurvivors
Description:
Zurvivors is a card game that will challenge your fears and put you in the middle of a city taken by the zombie apocalypse.

Your goal as a survivor is to flee through the city streets until you reach the rescue helicopter within 6 hours, but if you are caught by the zombie horde, you should help your new comrades exterminate the human race.

To advance on city streets, survivors must reveal cards to compose one of 3 personal goals, giving advantage to those who complete first.

Various supplies can be found on city streets and stored in your backpack if you can get them.

Each survivor has a different ability that can be activated once per round, making the match even more exciting.

If some unarmed survivor meets the horde wandering the street, that's not a good sign ... for your friends.

You will become a zombie of the horde that will play in favor of eliminating the survivors!

Would you and your friends survive for 6 hours?
Time is decisive, so hurry! Before it's too late.

Name: Die Tour de Tarif
Description:
Bike races for 2 - 6 players, with dice throws and card collecting.

Each player has three riders at the start. To start, you need to roll a six. Before the dice roll, the player must indicate one of his three riders for whom the roll is used.

The route is divided into three sections and there are different colored event fields.

Opposing riders can be thrown out. But not in all fields.
There are the following fields:
3 start fields
a target field
white squares (you can hit opposing riders)

Black, red, yellow squares: here the player will be asked questions of the corresponding color, depending on the color field. The question is the player sitting behind the player. If the question is answered correctly, the player gets the card, he has not given a correct answer, then the questioner may keep the card.

Blue fields: these fields serve the catering of the drivers, here can not be beaten. The VIP fields, before leaving you can call according to "VIP-VIP" and then die, the number is then doubled. However, if you only roll a 1, you have to go back to the last stage start.

Pink fields: are event fields, the texts are on the plan.
At the end of the racetrack, at the third stage you can not leave the time loop until you have collected 15 question cards, otherwise you have to go in a circle until you have done that, then you can leave the loop and drive to the finish. Who is the best cyclist?

—user summary

Name: Patanto
Description:
The board shows two circles on which one can carry out his activities. There are lots of action fields. The task of the players is to put together ideas for inventions and to apply for a patent in Germany or in Europe.
With patent sale or with licensing you make the big money. And with a clever game play, you can win as the richest player.
from inventor to millionaire.

—user summary

Name: Die DM rollt
Description:
Die DM rollt (1st game) 
The four caps of each player start on the spaces marked with a "S". Movement is determined by two dice. The player choses the result of one die to move a cap. If a cap gets on a space of another color with a number, the player gets the corresponding amount of game money from the player of this color. The other player may avoid this with a succesfull counter move. He rolls a die. If he manages to reach the cap of his opponent, the opponent has to pay and his cap is returned to a starting position.
If a player traps an opponent cap on a space without a number, he takes the trapped cap with him when he moves again. If this pair of caps get on a numberef space of the color of the trapped cap, the trapped player gets no counter move.
The game ends, when one player is broke. The player with the most money wins the game.

Money Maker (2nd game)
In this game movement is not decided by dice, but by a deck of Cards. Each player sets his 4 caps on numbered spaces of another color. Then each player draws three cards of his color. If there are caps on the spaces indicated by the cards the player has to pay his opponents the indicated amount of money. The owners of caps on spaces of his color not indicated by the cards have to pay hin instead. The game ends afer the whole talons have been played an agreed upon number of times. The player with the most money wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Battle Bears: The Board Game
Description:
Based off the Mobile game Battle Bears!

Have you and up to 5 friends ever crash landed on a hostile planet pursued by a horde of explosive zombie teddy bears and only enough supplies remaining for one of you to make it back off the planet? Have you had to Fight to the Death using your own unique abilities, and with the random weapons and equipment you can find to be the Last One Standing? After dying, have you then come back as a cute zombie teddy bear and attempted to revenge kill your opponents?

Oh, you haven't? Well why not? It's about time you had the experience. BattleBears is coming to your tabletop!

In Battle Bears: The Board Game the goal is to be the last bear standing! Each player takes two actions on their turn. You can shoot, run around picking up items, use a piece of gear or your special ability! At the end of your turn place a huggable swarm to try and trap your enemies. If you die, don’t worry - death isn’t the end! You come back as an even stronger, ultimate huggable set on taking revenge on the ones who destroyed you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Showdown Battle:  Marianas and Philippine Sea Jun44
Description:
Operational level game of the landings and any accompanying air and naval battle(s).  Individual fleet and light carriers and battleships - both Yamato and Musashi sortied in this - 2-ship cruiser and 4-ship destroyer units (mostly), Guam and Saipan invasion forces, and implicit submarines. Divebomber, torpedo bomber, and Japanese Betty medium bomber squadrons - fighters are also implicit (in the game system) for playability.
100 mile/160 kilometer hexes and 3-hour turns over a possible 6 days.  As for a good Leyte Gulf game, there could be one USN player in command of Task Force 52's landings, old battleships, and taffies (baby flattop groups) and one for modern battleship and fast carrier TF58 ... with coordinating communications possibly delayed? }:)
Secret *Japanese* strategic intelligence roll, with a 17% chance of them already near the Marianas and an also un-historical 33% chance of them entering the west side of the chartboard at the same time the Americans enter the east side - or they are delayed a full day, as historically.  Dummy units and detection rules for operational Fog of War.  My abstract "betting" ground combat system.

Game balance victory point compensation.  :)

—description from the designer

Name: Have A Heart
Description:
Object of the game: 
To dislodge opponents clip on heart with a pliable plastic sword.

Before Starting Play:
Each player takes one sword and one Heart that he clips on his person, below his shoulders or above his knees.
The Heart may not be placed on the arms. Any player then takes the arrows and throws them in the air or places them in a circle radius of about six feet , disregarding where the colors may fall. The spinner is then placed in the center of the circle.

How to play:
Each player stands on the outside pattern of the arrows . The first player then spins the dial . The dial stops on a blue arrow , the players quickly place any foot on any convenient blue arrow , with toes pointing in the direction of the arrow. When the spinner shows geeen players place the other foot on any green arrow . As the game continues , players may place either foot on the arrow that is most convenient to them . When the spinner stops on a Heart, the player calls out “HAVE A HEART” and each player tries to get each other’s heart with his sword. The hearts may be removed by either knocking them off or by placing the curved part of the sword thru the hole in the heart and pulling it off. If a player loses balance and falls or his heart is removed , he is eliminated from the game. The last player remaining is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Fly Fight Win: Warbirds
Description:
Fly Fight Win: Warbirds is a hex-based, miniatures wargame rules set for aerial combat in World War II. It emphasizes the importance of speed, altitude, and pilot skill, and minimizes much of the tedium typically associated with air-to-air combat games. It includes statistics for more than 60 frontline fighters of the era and a pilot advancement system for campaign games.

Warbirds is a standalone rules set and the first game in the Fly Fight Win series. All games in the series are designed for playability but retain sufficient detail to recreate historical outcomes (with a nod towards the physics of flight). Most scenarios can be played in under 60 minutes.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-earth – Villains of Eriador Figure Pack
Description:
Enhance your games of The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-earth with new figures, trinkets, and titles! No matter whether you seek the Ember Crown or are investigating a rash of thefts across Eriador, you can bring the dastardly villains you face to life with the Villains of Eriador Figure Pack.

This figure pack contains three detailed, unpainted plastic figures that give the Gulgotar, Atarin, and Coalfang enemies from both the Bones of Arnor and Hunt for the Ember Crown campaigns an imposing presence on your tabletop. But you don't have to face these dastardly villains unprepared. Six new trinkets and three exciting new titles give you new ways to deal with any enemies you come across.
